Try bodyweight exercises: Without access to weights or gym equipment, you can still get a great workout by doing bodyweight exercises like push-ups, squats, lunges, and planks. These exercises can be done anywhere and don't require any equipment.

Take up a non-traditional sport: If all sporting equipment is gone, consider taking up a non-traditional sport like frisbee, ultimate frisbee, or even pogo sticks. These activities can be a lot of fun and provide a good cardiovascular workout.
Practice yoga or meditation: Yoga and meditation are great ways to stay active and fit without any equipment. They can help improve flexibility, balance, and mental well-being.
Go for a hike or walk: If you have access to nature, go for a hike or walk in a park or forest. This can be a great way to get some exercise while enjoying the outdoors.
Do some gardening or house chores: Gardening and house chores can be a great way to get some exercise and stay active. They can help improve your strength, flexibility, and cardiovascular fitness.
